p: In many parts of the world, sea fennel is used as a food ingredient for several traditional recipes. It is especially known for its good sensory traits [ 3], owed to its high essential oils content [ 3, 4, 5]. Furthermore, sea fennel is highly appreciated for both nutritional and medicinal uses, because the leaves contains several healthy compounds [ 2, 6] and the seeds are rich in essential fatty acids [ 5]. At the same time, sea fennel is currently underutilized for commercial cultivation although it may be considered as a sustainable and promising crop, even if grown on saline soils [ 1, 6].
